Options.Name: resource_group_name
Options.Documentation: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

Options.Name: server_name
Options.Documentation: The name of the server.

Options.Name: parameters
Options.Documentation: The required parameters for creating or updating a server.

Options.Name: sku
Options.Documentation: The SKU (pricing tier) of the server.

SubOptions.Name: name
SubOptions.Documentation: The name of the sku, typically, a letter + Number code, e.g. P3.

SubOptions.Name: tier
SubOptions.Documentation: The tier of the particular SKU, e.g. Basic.

SubOptions.Name: capacity
SubOptions.Documentation: The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units.

SubOptions.Name: size
SubOptions.Documentation: The size code, to be interpreted by resource as appropriate.

Options.Name: properties
Options.Documentation: Properties of the server.

Options.Name: location
Options.Documentation: Resource location. If not set, location from the resource group will be used as default.

Options.Name: storage_mb
Options.Documentation: The maximum storage allowed for a server.

Options.Name: version
Options.Documentation: Server version.

Options.Name: ssl_enforcement
Options.Documentation: Enable SSL enforcement.

Options.Name: create_mode
Options.Documentation: Currently only 'Default' value supported

Options.Name: administrator_login
Options.Documentation: The administrator's login name of a server. Can only be specified when the server is being created (and is required for creation).

Options.Name: administrator_login_password
Options.Documentation: The password of the administrator login.

ResponseFields.Name: location
ResponseFields.Description: The location the resource resides in.

ResponseFields.Name: tags
ResponseFields.Description: Application-specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

ResponseFields.Name: sku
ResponseFields.Description: The SKU (pricing tier) of the server.

SubFields.Name: name
SubFields.Description: The name of the sku, typically, a letter + Number code, e.g. P3.

SubFields.Name: tier
SubFields.Description: The tier of the particular SKU, e.g. Basic. Possible values include: 'Basic', 'Standard'

SubFields.Name: capacity
SubFields.Description: The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units.

SubFields.Name: size
SubFields.Description: The size code, to be interpreted by resource as appropriate.

ResponseFields.Name: administrator_login
ResponseFields.Description: The administrator's login name of a server. Can only be specified when the server is being created (and is required for creation).

ResponseFields.Name: storage_mb
ResponseFields.Description: The maximum storage allowed for a server.

ResponseFields.Name: ssl_enforcement
ResponseFields.Description: Enable ssl enforcement or not when connect to server. Possible values include: 'Enabled', 'Disabled'

ResponseFields.Name: user_visible_state
ResponseFields.Description: A state of a server that is visible to user. Possible values include: 'Ready', 'Dropping', 'Disabled'

ResponseFields.Name: fully_qualified_domain_name
ResponseFields.Description: The fully qualified domain name of a server.

Options.Name: firewall_rule_name
Options.Documentation: The name of the server firewall rule.

Options.Name: parameters
Options.Documentation: The required parameters for creating or updating a firewall rule.

Options.Name: start_ip_address
Options.Documentation: The start IP address of the server firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

Options.Name: end_ip_address
Options.Documentation: The end IP address of the server firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

ResponseFields.Name: start_ip_address
ResponseFields.Description: The start IP address of the server firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

ResponseFields.Name: end_ip_address
ResponseFields.Description: The end IP address of the server firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

Options.Name: virtual_network_rule_name
Options.Documentation: The name of the virtual network rule.

Options.Name: parameters
Options.Documentation: The requested virtual Network Rule Resource state.

Options.Name: virtual_network_subnet_id
Options.Documentation: The ARM resource id of the virtual network subnet.

Options.Name: ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint
Options.Documentation: Create firewall rule before the virtual network has vnet service endpoint enabled.

ResponseFields.Name: virtual_network_subnet_id
ResponseFields.Description: The ARM resource id of the virtual network subnet.

ResponseFields.Name: ignore_missing_vnet_service_endpoint
ResponseFields.Description: Create firewall rule before the virtual network has vnet service endpoint enabled.

ResponseFields.Name: state
ResponseFields.Description: Virtual Network Rule State. Possible values include: 'Initializing', 'InProgress', 'Ready', 'Deleting', 'Unknown'

Name: PostgreSQLManagementClient
Operations: Servers[ create update delete get list_by_resource_group list MAIN FACTS ]
FirewallRules[ create_or_update delete get list_by_server MAIN FACTS ]
VirtualNetworkRules[ get create_or_update delete list_by_server MAIN FACTS ]
Databases[ create_or_update delete get list_by_server MAIN FACTS ]
Configurations[ create_or_update get list_by_server MAIN FACTS ]
